original_solution_mapping.L1: The cost of the 200 employees is 200 employees * $12/employee/hour = $<<200*12=2400>>2400 per hour.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The cost of the 40 employees is 40 employees * $14/employee/hour = $<<40*14=560>>560 per hour.
original_solution_mapping.L3: The rest means 300 employees - 200 employees - 40 employees = <<300-200-40=60>>60 employees.
original_solution_mapping.L4: These 60 employees' employment costs are at 60 employees * $17/employee/hour = $<<60*17=1020>>1020 per hour.
original_solution_mapping.L5: So in total all employees earn $2400/hour + $560/hour + $1020/hour = $3980/hour.
original_solution_mapping.L6: During an 8-hour shift, this cost would be at 8 hours * $3980/hour = $<<8*3980=31840>>31840.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2374.
    Returns: the total cost to employ all people for one 8-hour long shift.
    """
    # L1
    employees_group1 = 200 # 200 of them
    hourly_rate_group1 = 12 # $12 per hour
    cost_group1_per_hour = employees_group1 * hourly_rate_group1

    # L2
    employees_group2 = 40 # 40 of them
    hourly_rate_group2 = 14 # $14 per hour
    cost_group2_per_hour = employees_group2 * hourly_rate_group2

    # L3
    total_employees = 300 # 300 employees
    employees_group3 = total_employees - employees_group1 - employees_group2

    # L4
    hourly_rate_group3 = 17 # $17 per hour
    cost_group3_per_hour = employees_group3 * hourly_rate_group3

    # L5
    total_cost_per_hour = cost_group1_per_hour + cost_group2_per_hour + cost_group3_per_hour

    # L6
    shift_hours = 8 # one 8-hour long shift
    total_cost_per_shift = shift_hours * total_cost_per_hour

    # FA
    answer = total_cost_per_shift
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The cost of the {employees_group1} employees is {employees_group1} employees * ${hourly_rate_group1}/employee/hour = $<<{employees_group1}*{hourly_rate_group1}={cost_group1_per_hour}>>{cost_group1_per_hour} per hour.

The cost of the {employees_group2} employees is {employees_group2} employees * ${hourly_rate_group2}/employee/hour = $<<{employees_group2}*{hourly_rate_group2}={cost_group2_per_hour}>>{cost_group2_per_hour} per hour.

The rest means {total_employees} employees - {employees_group1} employees - {employees_group2} employees = <<{total_employees}-{employees_group1}-{employees_group2}={employees_group3}>>{employees_group3} employees.

These {employees_group3} employees' employment costs are at {employees_group3} employees * ${hourly_rate_group3}/employee/hour = $<<{employees_group3}*{hourly_rate_group3}={cost_group3_per_hour}>>{cost_group3_per_hour} per hour.
So in total all employees earn ${cost_group1_per_hour}/hour + ${cost_group2_per_hour}/hour + ${cost_group3_per_hour}/hour = ${total_cost_per_hour}/hour.
During an {shift_hours}-hour shift, this cost would be at {shift_hours} hours * ${total_cost_per_hour}/hour = $<<{shift_hours}*{total_cost_per_hour}={total_cost_per_shift}>>{total_cost_per_shift}.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The cost of the 200 employees is 200 employees * $12/employee/hour = $<<200*12=2400>>2400 per hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The cost of the 40 employees is 40 employees * $14/employee/hour = $<<40*14=560>>560 per hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The rest means 300 employees - 200 employees - 40 employees = <<300-200-40=60>>60 employees.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: These 60 employees' employment costs are at 60 employees * $14/employee/hour = $<<60*14=840>>840 per hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: So in total all employees earn $2400/hour + $560/hour + $840/hour = $3800/hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: During an 8-hour shift, this cost would be at 8 hours * $3800/hour = $<<8*3800=30400>>30400.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'hourly_rate_group2' (14) was used instead of 'hourly_rate_group3' (17).
